CommandAnAnimal.Description:
You issue an order to a companion.

Most companions know the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.HYNhdaPtF1QmQbR3], @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.d5I6018Mci2SWokk], @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ], @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.OdIUybJ3ddfL7wzj], @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Bcxarzksqt9ezrs6], and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VjxZFuUXrCU94MWR] basic actions.

Your companion gains 2 actions during your turn if you use the Command an Animal action to command it; this replaces the usual effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.q9nbyIF0PEBqMtYe], and you don't need to attempt a Nature check.
CommandAnAnimal.Title: Command {name}

ActTogether.Description:
You and your eidolon act as one.

Either you or your eidolon takes an action or activity using the same number of actions as Act Together, and the other takes a single action.
ActTogether.Title: Act Together ({name})

Sustain.Description:
{spellCompendium}'s duration extends until the end of your next turn. (Sustaining more than once in the same turn doesn't extend the duration to subsequent turns.) It can be sustained up to {duration}.

Immediately when you finish casting, the summoned creature uses its 2 actions for that turn. Summoned creatures can be banished by various spells and effects. They are automatically banished if reduced to 0 Hit Points or if the spell that called them ends (such as being disrupted).
Sustain.Title: Sustain {name}

NotSustained.Description: Summoned creatures are automatically banished if the spell that called them ends (such as not being sustained before the end of your turn).
NotSustained.Title: {name} was not sustained
